name: Augustin Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Augustin for 3 nights at the end of January. Booking through the hotel directly, our room was $100 a night, breakfast included. The staff were always effcient and friendly, especially when we checked in at 1 in the morning. Looking at the floor plan, it appeared as if our room (328) was one of the largest rooms on the floor....not quite a suite, but definitely larger than a standard room, with almost its own seating/work area and entrance way. The room its self was nicely furnished and very comfortable. It faced over a pedestrian street at the rear of the hotel (which was never nosiy) where there were restaurants, cafes, shops, and a Rema 1000 grocery store which was perfect for stocking up on food. The heated floor and heated towel rack in the large bathroom were great touches, as was the Björn Borg soap provided (which smelled very nice!).
reviews.title: A wonderful hotel.

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was excellent....lots of choices and very fresh. The other public spaces in the hotel were just as comfortable as the room, with complimentary waffles and coffee provided in the library in the late afteroon/early evening. Two computers were in the lobby for complimentary internet access as well (I don't know if wireless internet is provided in the guest rooms).
reviews.title: 2Star hotel at 5 star price

reviews.text: Provided that we paid $100 a night, breakfast included, and had one of the largest rooms in the hotel, it was one of the best values we'd ever received at a hotel. We wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Augustin again. We highly, highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Great boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Augustin November 6, originally booked for 4 nights. The room we had was very small, dimly lit---hard to read. The pant press didn't work, and hadn't for a while according to the front desk. The breakfast room includede in the rate, had dirty dishes on most tables, and the lady looking after it kept going outside to smoke! The location wasn't that good, didn't appear to have any restaurants in the area. We moved the next day to the SAS Radisson Norge. Got a large bright room, excellent breakfast, FOR THE SAME PRICE as the Augustin. The location is on a pedestrian mall, 5 minutes from the harbour and 10 minutes walk to the train station. Radisson 5 star value. Augustin 2 star at 5 star price!
reviews.title: Interesting building

description: Centrally located in town centre with some rooms overlooking the harbour. All main attractions within walking distance. Shopping district and pedestrian street just outside the hotel. Family run since 1919. Award winning design(intarsia guestroom doors) in interior. Rich selection of contemporary art in guest rooms and lounges. Wine spectator awarded wine bar and restaurant in 400 year-old six room stone-vaulted cellar. Ten years with best occupancy rate in Bergen as a mid-class, great-value hotel with a homey atmosphere.
